channel.title: Background size 317
channel.description: Hey guys can anyone tel me what the background size is for a 317 server ?

item.title: Background size 317
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:8, topic:538758”]What are you talking about? Boolean clearly mentioned the word ‘cache’. I don’t know why you even said that.

If you think pressing print screen and cropping the image is going to give you the actual size then you more retarded then I expected.[/quote]
If you’d love to look at the thread, Boolean–'s post is no longer here, and was not here when I posted. That is why I said what I said.
Also, I’m clearly not retarded because I just printscreened my client, and cropped it.
You know what the dimensions came out to? 765x503
That’s weird because I’m damn sure that is the answer here.

Now, you can go back to sucking dick, Arick.

Read full topic

item.title: Background size 317
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:7, topic:538758”][quote author=Boolean-- link=topic=657590.msg4399203#msg4399203 date=1390121692]

3.A easy way is to go into your cache and edit the background on regular paint. therfore you can get the actual size of the background.

The orig background is 383x503. So how would you find that in the cache?

No one said anything about the cache?

well your obviously wrong.
Cause it is in your cache. edit your background onto paint and search the size of it. that easy!
[/quote]
Why are you saying I’m wrong? What I said works fine.
If you’re saying Hco is wrong, you need to learn how to quote properly.[/quote]
What are you talking about? Boolean clearly mentioned the word ‘cache’. I don’t know why you even said that.

If you think pressing print screen and cropping the image is going to give you the actual size then you more retarded then I expected.

Read full topic

item.title: Background size 317
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Did this seriously need a topic? 1) Google would have had THOUSANDS of results on this.
2) Your client tells you how big it is, because obviously it needs to construct the JFrame to match the dimensions.
3) It’s not hard to printscreen your client as it’s open, and then crop it to see the size.

Read full topic
